author: Ben Walther
content: An advanced question, if I may. Say you're running a standard J2EE stack to host a web app. With or without struts or spring, doesn't matter. You're hosting JSPs. An attacker finds a way to upload a JSP file to your website. That attacker can run Java code on your behalf - but here's the kicker - can the attacker prompt an interactive jython console that hooks straight into your application?

author: pdp
content: why not? it should be possible.
